programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we meet the animals of Africa. We'll see how the zebra is able to use its stripes as camouflage against its colorblind nemesis. Explore the engineering of a giraffe's neck, and feel the power of a hyena's jaws.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: An Elephant seals nose inflates to amplify its roar, which can be heard up to a mile away! Plus, African wild dog have one of the most powerful bite forces on Earth! Giant ant eaters w/o teeth have 2 foot long tongues and can eat 30k insects per day!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the natural beauty of the Canadian Rockies. Philippe canoes on the famous, glacier-fed Lake Louise at Banff National Park. We hike up a glacier at Jasper National Park and discover much more.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Philippe visits an estuary in North Carolina and catches blue crabs, which have adapted to both saltwater and freshwater. Then Philippe goes to Curacao and takes a submersible 500 feet below the surface to look at sea life. Later, a trip to NASA.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 25 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Jack Rowlett joins the show! You can't kill the Chaos. Jack talks about proving the naysayers wrong, and the culture that he and Blaze have set for Carolina. With the 2025 HOF class being announced, the fellas give their mount rushmore of PLL players. Doogs updates his who should the MVP should've been. Lastly, a start bench cut of Gatorade flavors.

Jack talks about proving the naysayers wrong, and the culture that he and Blaze have set for Carolina. With the 2025 HOF class being announced, the fellas give their mount rushmore of PLL players. Doogs updates his who should the MVP should've been. Lastly, a start bench cut of Gatorade flavors.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In three epic clashes, JOSH KREJCI welcomes NATE MORROW to the Squared Circle,TOMMY STRYDOM takes on COREY ROBERTS and BOBBY TAYLOR goes to war with RYAN ROBERTS. Don't miss these incredible showings of toughness from Omaha!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Prospects throw down in a handful of first-time showings in Denver with RAMIRO FIGUEROA vs BRETT HUDSON and JOSH HUBER vs ANDREW YATES. Also, in BKFC veteran matchups, CRISTINA CRIST, CASSIE ROBB, SAWYER DEPEE and KEEGAN VANDERMEER match up.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Watch some serious showings of toughness and skill asJOSEPH CREER vs DANIEL MITCHELL,ZEB VINCENT vs CASEY MOSES,DERRICK FINDLEY vs SERGIO LOPEZ &DYLAN SCHULTE vs ROBERTO ARMAS lay it all on the line in Denver.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Three titles are on the line in Hollywood, Florida with WARREN vs ESCOBOZA fighting for light heavyweight gold, BLAS vsRICHARDSON battling at bantamweight and bad blood boils over as BRYAN DURAN comes for KAI STEWART'S featherweight strap!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In a showcase of incredible bare-knuckle matchmaking,LEONARDO PERDOMO vs LEO BERCIER,GEE PEREZ vs ALBERT INCLAN,CHRISTINE VICENS vs MELANIE SHAH &JUSTIN IBARROLA vs RICK CARUSO demonstrate the grittiness of BKFC.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In four tough-fought wars, we see none of these bouts go the distance! Watch BKFC talent battle with SIMPSON vs SUAREZ,ZUCKERMAN vs CEDENO,PLAZAOLA vs DODSON &GARCIA vs LIVINGSTON at BKFC 62.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In an absolutely electric showing for the BKFC debut at the Pechanga Resort & Casino,VICTOR ROSAS vs LUIS INIGUEZ,FERNANDO GONZALEZ vs RODNEY THOMAS &RUBEN WARR vs ROBBIE PERALTA shock the crowd with jaw-dropping scraps!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Watch exceptional matchups & brutal finishes from Pechanga's first ever BKFC Fight Night! Featuring HANSEN vs YOST,VO vs PETTIT,GUTIERREZ vs GARCIA &VILLASENOR vs FIELDS.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Not a single fight from Pechanga disappointed the live audience, nor the viewers at home! Watch some of BKFC's warriors toe the line in. Featuring JORDAN CHRISTENSEN vs RILEY PELLEGRINO,JOSEPH WHITE vs CALEB AVILA &SQUIRE REDFERN vs RICHARD BROOKS.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 2
programme.desc: The festivities continue on Holidays with Hellmuth as Phil takes on all comers in this $100/$200 cash game. Rewatch the whole show now as he goes up against Dan Shak Brian Potashnik David 'Doc' Sands Avi Freedman and Rick Thompson.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 1A of the 2004 WSOP Main Event is underway with Daniel Negreanu, Men "The Master" Nguyen, and John Hennigan on the feature table. Defending champion Chris Moneymaker kicks off his title defense, while several big names find themselves heading home early.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Coverage continues on Day 1B of the WSOP Main Event, and last year's runner-up Sammy Farha headlines the feature table along with John Juanda. Chris Ferguson and "Miami" John Cernuto then join the feature table action, as many poker pros hit the rail on Day 1B.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 2 action in the WSOP Main Event sees Doyle Brunson headline the feature table along with Scott Fischman. Siblings Howard Lederer and Annie Duke are eliminated, along with two previous Main Event champions.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Money day has arrived in the WSOP Main Event with just 277 players remaining on Day 3. Gus Hansen takes center stage on the feature table, and is joined by Daniel Alaei and Dan Harrington while two other previous champions also survive the day.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 149 players remain in the 2004 WSOP Main Event, and Mike Matusow headlines the feature table alongside Greg "Fossilman" Raymer and John Esposito. However, it would be John Murphy, Josh Arieh, and Marcel Luske climbing to the top of the leaderboard.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: World Champions Dan Harrington and Chris Ferguson headline the feature table on Day 5 of the WSOP Main Event. The only other former champion wouldn't survive, as Doyle Brunson was eliminated.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 3
programme.desc: The final night of Holidays with Hellmuth brought out a festive lineup and some great poker action! Poker legends Phil Hellmuth Daniel Negreanu and Doyle Brunson were joined by Maria Ho and first-timers Dave Penski and Joe Marchese with $150000 at st

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #1: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Jeremy Ausmus is the chip leader ahead of Erik Seidel, Jacky Wang, Nick Schulman, Cole Ferraro, Anthony Hu, and Cary Katz, as the final seven players play for the $204,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #2: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Michael Brinkenhoff is the chip leader ahead of Ethan Yau, Alex Foxen, Stephen Song, Masashi Oya, and Dylan DeStefano, as the final six players play for the $197,600 first-place prize.

programme.title: Mixed Christmas
programme.desc: Aurora wants to enjoy the holidays this year in some warmth and sunshine, and invites her three best friends to Miami for a Christmas trip to remember. When they arrive at their AirBnb, they discover it's been double booked by Aurora's ex-girlfriend and her new partner Axel. They have no choice but to combine their plans, and celebrate the holiday together.

programme.title: The Last Days of an Escort
programme.desc: Kitty, a struggling escort, agrees to be documented for a film. Her roommate, Star, a more successful escort, reluctantly joins. A new client, Earl, changes their lives forever when he asks to see Kitty and Star together. Kitty's world becomes increasingly dangerous as she navigates the dark underworld of escorting.

programme.title: Teacher's Pet
programme.desc: A young man and his teacher enter into an inappropriate relationship with deadly consequences.

programme.title: The Wake Up Call
programme.desc: Upon learning of his father’s cancer diagnosis, a gifted research student dedicates every waking hour to finding a cure.

programme.title: Too Little Too Late
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse when a philandering man with blood on his hands discovers his fiancée is pregnant.

programme.title: Back and Forth
programme.desc: Two people who love skating meet and fall for each other. But one hides something that could destroy their relationship and break hearts.

programme.title: Tilt
programme.desc: Nia, raised in a dysfunctional household, has a chance to stepout of her mother's shadow when she is introduced to the game of pinball.

programme.title: Predatory Behavior
programme.desc: Sex workers are vanishing all over the city and Detectives Powell and Scott are running out of time to catch the culprit before he strikes again.

programme.title: What a Day Before Christmas
programme.desc: Nathan and Naomi are at odds about the direction of their marriage, and reluctance to get in the Christmas Spirit is shown by Nathan. As an ultimatum, it is insisted by Naomi that the holidays are spent by Nathan with her and her family, but it is Christmas Eve. The help of Nathan's cousin Keith is enlisted, and a road trip is embarked upon by the two as they race against time. An attempt is made to get home for the holidays and save the marriage.

programme.title: Glistening in the Snow
programme.desc: When struggling club owner Anaja finds out that her co-owner, Donovan, is coming to town for the holiday, she expects him to help keep the doors open. However, his fiancé Addie wants him to sell the club. When the owners and staff are trapped in the club during a snow storm, they will have to work together to resolve their issues with each other.

programme.title: Missing you this Christmas
programme.desc: Carmen's family has an annual Christmas tradition that supports her neighborhood. When her mother dies suddenly, she looses the holiday spirit, and no longer wants to continue, until she's visited by her late father's spirit who encourages her to keep hope alive.

programme.title: A Holiday for Harmony
programme.desc: Jaxon Moore is a struggling arcade bar owner with debt and facing a possible shutdown before the holiday season. When his sister dies in a car crash, he becomes the guardian of his young niece Harmony, who inherited a trust fund from her late mother.

programme.title: Rain for Christmas
programme.desc: A decision is made by Malik to bring his girlfriend home to Houston for Christmas. When she is met by his family, it is thought by them that he is all wrong for her. The grandpa's nurse, Rain, is met by Malik, and the true meaning of love and what is really wanted for Christmas are soon realized by him.

programme.title: Naughty or Nice
programme.desc: Melody, an exotic dancer, and her doctor boyfriend, Patrick, prepare to spend the holidays with Patrick's family. When they arrive, they are met by Patrick's overprotective judgmental mother, and she unleashes her wrath on Melody, as she's not good enough for her son.

programme.title: Christmas With da Fam
programme.desc: After Malcom proposes to Serenity, she takes him home to meet her family for the holidays. The spirit is alive, until they discover that Serenity's ex Denzel is living with her family after a house fire. A rivalry develops between Malcolm and Denzel that ends up in a hilarious battle of wits over the holiday weekend.

programme.title: The Struggle 2: The Dilemma
programme.desc: Darnell gets released from jail and tries to take back control of his territory.

programme.title: Lacee
programme.desc: A hot, up-and-coming, all-female R&B group embarks on a journey of sex, power and music business betrayal on their road to the big time.

programme.title: Lacee: Rise 2 the Top
programme.desc: After a run-in with the girl group LACEE, Karin decides to step out on her own as a solo artist. As she preps for her solo debut, a former lover brings out a new artist that will compete for the reigning spot as the new R&B diva.

programme.title: Loyalty
programme.desc: An independent drug dealer learns his girlfriend used to date his competitor and believes they might still be messing around.

programme.title: Loyalty 2 the Return of T Bone
programme.desc: After making bail, the notorious killer and drug lord T Bone returns to the streets of Harlem, NY to clean up the family business and tie all loose ends. But once again the tables are turned when T Bone is betrayed by someone close.

programme.title: Mama Jones
programme.desc: Following a family tragedy, a grief-stricken matriarch becomes territorial when her son and his girlfriend come home with a surprise.

programme.title: Knee Deep

programme.title: No Disrespect
programme.desc: Milk runs the streets efficiently in his father's absence. After 15 years in prison, his father, Bull, returns to claim what is rightfully his.

programme.title: Heavy

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell 'Em I Said It
programme.desc: The excitable comic again proves why he is one of the world’s premiere funnymen, ripping into racial stereotypes, Viagra, the First Lady, and more.

programme.title: Earthquake: (Practice) the Secret Files of Earthquake
programme.desc: Earthquake brings his hilarious and straightforward signature comedic style to his all-new stand-up special that you won’t want to miss.

programme.title: Dino Vigo: All In
programme.desc: A skilled writer, as well as performer-Vigo seems poised to take the comedy world by storm and yet remains remarkably grounded in his approach to his craft.

programme.title: Theodore M.E. Taylor's The Bowtie Guy
programme.desc: Follow comedian Theodore M.E. Taylor as he discusses cultural and political differences, the pressures of poverty and passing in affluent company, and code switching and shaping identity around social prejudices in his breakout comedy special.

programme.title: Traffic Jam Comedy Jam: Vol. 2
programme.desc: Marc Brissett teams up with Talent Da Comedian for hilarious standup comedy featuring Divine and Aldo Marachlian.

programme.title: Jenny McCarthy's Dirty, Sexy, Funny
programme.desc: Jenny McCarthy’s brand of naughty comedy gets a boost from popular female comedians, including Tiffany Haddish, on the realities of being a woman.

programme.title: Zarna Garg: One in a Billion
programme.desc: Zarna, an Indian-Immigrant mom, has plenty to joke about.

programme.title: Leah Rudick: Spiraling
programme.desc: Comedian and viral social media sensation Leah Rudick delves into marriage, family psychics, and anxiety attacks in the Cracker Barrel.

programme.title: Kylie Brakeman: Linda Hollywood's Big Night
programme.desc: Character comedian Kylie Brakeman teaches an acting masterclass as Linda Hollywood, a problematic, old school talent agent on a mission to spread her industry wisdom-and save her own career in the process.

programme.title: Cara Connors: Straight for Pay
programme.desc: Connors delivers an exuberant hour of full-body laughs and plenty of thought-provoking material in her breakout debut comedy special.

programme.title: Christine Hurley: Post-Vasectomy
programme.desc: Christine Hurley shares the story of her life, and she pulls no punches.

programme.title: Nish Kumar: Your Power, Your Control
programme.desc: It's been an era of upheaval and uncertainty, and yet the British comic manages to take these problems very personally in this live stand-up special.

programme.title: Damon Millard: Nothing to Nobody
programme.desc: Seven years after his debut, Damon Millard returns with a comedy special.

programme.title: Nick Alexander Presents Nick Alexander
programme.desc: Nick Alexander marks his debut special, as he performs a coming-of-age set highlighting boyhood, his Haitian upbringing, relationships, depression, the pandemic, and everything in between while celebrating his birthday.

programme.title: Paul Reiser: Life, Death & Rice Pudding
programme.desc: Paul Reiser discusses downsizing, marriage and rice pudding in his first stand-up special in more than 30 years.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Good Deal
programme.desc: The Silicon Valley star uses his debut stand-up special to discuss tall women, disappointing his parents, and how he learned English from rap videos.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Guess How Much?
programme.desc: Yang dives into love languages, loser friends and negotiating with his Asian parents.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Quality Time
programme.desc: The comedian discusses why we aren’t honest about not wanting to attend events, lying to children, and so much more in this hilarious special.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Noble Ape
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy star describes how his wife faced a medical crisis, and he attempted to hold down the fort for their five children.

programme.title: Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Fran Drescher leads a cast of mature women of stand-up in a night of uninhibited comedy; featuring Carole Montgomery, Luenell, Lynne Koplitz, Kerri Louise and Vanessa Hollingshead.

programme.title: More Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Caroline Rhea headlines a cast of women for a night of uninhibited stand-up comedy; featuring Carol Leifer, Tammy Pescatelli, Thea Vidale, Carole Montgomery, and Julia Scotti.

programme.title: Even More Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Golden Globe winner Teri Hatcher joins the stage with some of the funniest women in comedy for one night of over-the-top, uninhibited standup.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: War Paint
programme.desc: Iliza Shlesinger performs her first stand-up special in her hometown of Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Leanne Morgan: So Yummy
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Jenny McCarthy's Dirty, Sexy, Funny
programme.desc: Jenny McCarthy’s brand of naughty comedy gets a boost from popular female comedians, including Tiffany Haddish, on the realities of being a woman.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
programme.desc: The comic performs his well-known characters, including Achmed the Dead Terrorist.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Minding the Monsters
programme.desc: The comedian and ventriloquist extraordinaire, along with this felt friends, visits a haunted house where hilarious chaos ensues.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquist’s dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, José Jalapeño, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: The comedian and his puppets perform in the gorgeous Dolby Theatre, featuring hilarious sketches with surprise guests and lots of laughs.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Will Foskey: All Things Sacred
programme.desc: This debut comedy special at Atlanta’s Laughing Skull Lounge charts the native Georgian’s childhood in the burbs to his dalliances with centenarians.

programme.title: Bill Squire: We're Getting Famous
programme.desc: From the Agora Theater in Cleveland, Ohio, hometown comedy legend Bill Squire's comedy special continues to discover the threads connecting his own childhood to his role as a parent.

programme.title: Tamar Rubin: But Sir
programme.desc: Tamar Rubin stakes her claim as a fresh comedic voice in her debut special, "But Sir!"; she combines a gritty punk sensibility with the polish of a trained actor.

programme.title: Ginny Hogan: Regression
programme.desc: Ginny Hogan has an idea of what her life should look like by 30, and she's got a plan to get herself there.

programme.title: Andrew Orvedahl: Doom Math
programme.desc: The debut special from Andrew Orvedahl filmed in front of a sold out crowd in his hometown of Denver, Colo.

programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Beverly Rose's first birthday -- but it's not all cake and candles -- when Becky and Emilio disagree on what kind of party they should have.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.desc: "Teenagers From Outer Space" (1959) Science fiction. Alien teens with ray guns land on Earth to breed their lobsterlike space cattle. With David Love, Dawn Anderson, Harvey B. Dunn.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gamera vs. Barugon" (1966) Science fiction. The fire-breathing flying turtle meets a cold-tongued rainbow-death-ray beamer. With Kojiro Hongo, Kyoko Enami, Akira Natsuki.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000: Shorts
programme.desc: The first episode of the 1952 serial featuring Commander Cody's trip to the moon.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A mad scientist creates havock when an experiment to stop the aging process goes awry.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000: Stranded in Space
programme.desc: Joel and the Bots roast this unsuccessful 1970s TV pilot about an astronaut stuck on an Earth-like planet where perfect order rules.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The crew stages their own moon landing pageant as they watch the film Moon Zero Two (1969) about an astronaut hired to capture an asteroid made of sapphires.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Crash of the Moons" (1954) Science Fiction. Our hero fights evil in outer space. From the "Rocky Jones, Space Ranger" TV series.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The heroic muscleman takes on rock men and the bad queen of Samar.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Moon Zero Two" (1970) Science fiction. Miners stake claims on the moon, and fight usurpers. With James Olson, Catherina Von Schell, Warren Mitchell.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Project Moonbase" (1953) Science fiction. The president is a woman and so is the captain of a lunar space station in the year 1970. With Donna Martell, Hayden Rorke, Ross Ford.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The crew watches "Track of the Moon Beast," where a New Mexico mineralogist is transformed into a mindless humanoid-lizard monster after being hit by a meteor.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Emily's crew watch three humans and their robot friend defend the moon colonies in 1979's "The Shape of Things to Come" by H.G. Wells.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000: Radar Men from the Moon
programme.desc: Joel and the Bots suffer through Commando Cody foiling the moon’s mysterious menace in various stitched-together installments of the 1952 serial.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The crew watch an education short about the wonders a home economics major can do for young women in 1951's "The Home Economics Story"; lonely viking women set sail to rescue a group of enslaved men in 1957's "The Saga of the Viking Women and their Voyage to the Waters of the Great Sea Serpent"; Joel and the Bots consider the waffle, and present an iron that can turn waffles into pancakes at the invention exchange.

programme.title: Cinematic Titanic
programme.desc: American spies discover the Chinese have built a weapon capable of destroying the Earth.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Joel and the Bots learn the ins and outs of the circus in the short Here Comes the Circus (1946) and then try to make sense of the Nordic fairy tale film The Day the Earth Froze (1959).

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Mike and the Bots watch 1961s "Bloodlust"; Dr. Forrester's deranged mother comes for a visit.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Undead" (1957) Cult. A therapist and a prostitute visit the Dark Ages; directed by Roger Corman.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Blood Waters of Dr. Z" (1972) Horror. A Florida scientist turns into a walking catfish. With Marshall Grauer and Wade Popwell.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Giant Spider Invasion" (1975) Cult. Scientist and girlfriend spy car-size mutant spiders; with Steve Brodie, Barbara Hale.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Time of the Apes" (1987) Science fiction. Two children and a frozen woman wake up 2,000 years later, when apes and a computer rule the world. With Reiko Tokunaga, Hiroko Saito, Masaaki Kaji.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Corpse Vanishes" (1942) Horror. A mad botanist drains kidnapped brides to keep his 80-year-old wife looking young. With Bela Lugosi, Luana Walters, Elizabeth Russell.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. First up is Mayfair, with a prime location on the busy seafront in Fuengirola, Costa del Sol. The restaurant was set up 28 years ago by 68 year old Londoner Pat and her husband of 45 years, Jack. The good news is that Fuengirola is one of the only towns in Spain that has actually seen an increase in tourists since the recession with 1 and half million Brits visiting last year alone; the bad news is that Mayfair isn't benefitting. With thousands of hungry sun seekers right on its doorstep, the restaurant should be raking it in - but the place is totally empty.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode two sees Gordon tackle struggling Le Deck restaurant in Capbreton, a popular coastal town in South West France. British owners Tim and Debbie emigrated to France 28 years ago, where they met as holiday reps. Since then they've poured blood, sweat and tears into opening 3 ski restaurants in the Alps. With the arrival of their children, they set up home by the coast to enjoy the summer months together as a family. But unable to sit still, Tim launched Le Deck three years ago. Far from being a hobby, the restaurant has taken over his life.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode 3 sees Gordon travel to the stunning whitewashed mountain village of Gaucin, half an hour from the Costa del Sol. In a series first, Gordon is tackling a brand new up-market start up restaurant, La Granada Divino, it's only been open for 8 weeks but is already heading for disaster. Owned by architect Milan and former model Gina, they have never run a restaurant and have sunk their savings and retirement fund in to the place.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. This final episode in the series takes Gordon to the Costa Blanca and a sleepy village that's home to Quelcutti's restaurant and bar, run by the Quelcutti family. Former London cabbie Del and his wife Sue emigrated to Spain 10 years ago with their three children: Joe, Terry and daughter Ruby. The plan was to retire and live the dream while using their retirement money to set up a business for their kids to run. Unfortunately, the kids are running the business into the ground.

programme.title: Nightbreed
programme.desc: Aaron Boone (Craig Sheffer) is haunted by terrifying nightmares of a city of monsters. He goes to see a psychiatrist, Dr. Decker (David Cronenberg), for help. But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the gardening year gets underway at Longmeadow, Monty is tidying up his ornamental grass border, pruning roses and planning for summer scent. Joe Swift continues his series on trees when he gives tips for how to plant a tree for future success.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don makes a start on his new wild flower garden at Longmeadow and at last gets to taste the first new potatoes of the year. He also demonstrates how a radical chop of some border plants now can rejuvenate them for later in the season. Carol Klein celebrates a cottage garden favourite, the foxglove, and Joe Swift drops in on world renowned garden designer, Dan Pearson.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows what to do now to maximise next year's soft fruit crop by pruning his summer raspberries and planting on the strawberry runners he potted up a few weeks ago. As Monty harvests September's abundance in the vegetable garden he makes notes of the tastiest varieties he has grown this year which he would grow again next year, as well as sowing some quick growing crops to harvest in the autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is in Hampshire with the great horticulturist, Roy Lancaster, appreciating the virtues of the often overlooked St John's wort. Joe Swift is out and about too and visits a very unusual allotment in Tottenham, North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the holiday season well and truly upon us, Monty shares some timely tips on how to make sure your garden doesn't suffer while you are away. But there are some gardeners that daren't leave home, as Joe Swift discovered when he met Phillip Vowles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plans for next year's fruit harvest when he adds gooseberries to the fruit garden he planted earlier in the year. He also divides and moves herbaceous perennials and advises on the best bulbs to plant now for cut flowers next year. Frances Tophill meets a couple who have filled their garden with tender plants and devised a meticulous method of protecting them over the winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with Billy Carruthers in West Lothian, enjoying his wonderful and varied collection of flamboyant peonies. Joe Swift visits world-renowned opera venue Glyndebourne in Sussex and is given an exclusive tour of their gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don celebrates the arrival of summer by making a start on his new scented border, and offers a few suggestions for what to be getting on with this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don will be cutting back his delphiniums and adding a touch of the exotic to his Jewel Garden. Carol Klein is in Kent meeting lavender expert and breeder, Dr Simon Charlesworth, whose stunning walled garden is packed with many varieties of this beautifully scented plant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts a new project, a cutting garden, and gives advice on what to grow to provide plenty of cut flowers for gorgeous summer bouquets. We visit Cumbria to meet Jack Gott, who has been passionate about that most flamboyant of flowers, the dahlia, for more than forty years and has over a thousand plants in his garden; and James Alexander-Sinclair celebrates a harbinger of Spring, the ephemeral cherry blossom, at Alnwick Castle in Northumberland.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This week we are celebrating the work of the army of volunteers, which keeps gardens up and down the country looking their best for visitors. Frances Tophill continues her vegetable trials at RHS Rosemoor in Devon, when she plants out her allotment with the help of RHS volunteers and we visit the Bodnant Garden in North Wales to find out how the volunteers there guide visitors through the world famous Laburnum Arch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Tender vegetables, bedding plants and bees are the focus of Monty's gardening at Longmeadow as he plants out squashes and scented annuals, and harvests honey. Adam Frost is in London, looking at how small spaces in the metropolis can be utilised to make gardens for wildlife, food and relaxation. Also, we visit North Wales to meet a man with a passion for prehistoric plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the longest day of the year approaches, there's more time to be outside and enjoy the garden and Monty is no exception. Although some vegetables do not respond well to a late sowing, there are others that do and Monty gives his tips on late croppers to sow now. Carol Klein and Joe Swift make a visit to Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham to revel in the hundreds of summer flowering plants on display and to find design tips for small gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whilst celebrating the glory of summer flowers at Longmeadow, Monty has plenty of tips, from pruning and propagation techniques for different types of clematis to troubleshooting problems with roses. Carol Klein wades through streams and marshes to show us how gardeners can emulate nature when choosing the right water plants for our gardens, and we visit Norfolk to revel in an extraordinary collection of iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is reaping the rewards of the summer when he begins to harvest crops from the vegetable garden and gives tips on extending the flower season in the borders. Carol takes a trip to the seaside to discover why some plants thrive, despite being assaulted by salt-laden winds. We make a final visit to Sissinghurst, to catch up with Troy Scott-Smith and the changes that have been made to the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer gets into full swing, there is plenty for Monty to be doing at Longmeadow. He gets to grips with summer pruning as he tackles his espaliered pear trees. Nature's bounty is very much in evidence at Lord Rothschild's garden at Waddesdon Manor, where we get an exclusive look behind the scenes. Also, Joe Swift ponders ways of putting a contemporary twist on traditional bedding plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highs of the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that the rambling roses have finished flowering, Monty turns his attention to pruning and tying in new growth for a good display next year. On the 20th anniversary of the death of Geoff Hamilton, Adam Frost returns to the famous `Gardeners' World' location, Barnsdale, to pay tribute and to revisit some his own early gardening memories. Also, we travel to Abergavenny to visit the garden of a sweet pea enthusiast to get her top tips for growing the best blooms.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift pays a visit to the Northumberland garden of Chris Mullin who, after over twenty years as a Member of Parliament, has turned his attention to the renovation of his walled garden. And National Trust head gardener, Alan Power, catches up with the transformation of Shakespeare's New Place garden in Stratford-upon-Avon.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RESCUED: DeTomaso Pantera Entombed 45 Years Gets a Second Chance at Life
programme.desc: RESCUED: DeTomaso Pantera Entombed 45 Years Gets a Second Chance at Life

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Hertz Shelby GT350, European Classics, and an all-original Datusn 240Z
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ultimate BMW barn find, and a family feud over a "secret Chevy"
programme.desc: A Triumph Stag on a dead end road that leads Tom to a treasure trove of forgotten vacation cars hidden in 100-year-old barns. Next, we get the story of a family feud that caused a classic Chevy to be hidden away for decades.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Old race car, V8-powered Supra, hot rod Mustang and more!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen with 1937 Riley Lynx with a unique racing history. After that, Tom meets a whole family who are into unique "modern classics."

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | GM muscle cars, rotary Mazdas, and Ford Broncos
programme.desc: Tom Cotter stumbles upon some GM muscle cars, including a Buick GS Stage 1 and some Oldmobile 442s. Next, Tom finds an interesting old Mazda RX-4 along with a stash of some vintage Ford Broncos.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn find road trip in a restored Ford Country Squire wagon
programme.desc: After attempting to buff out a dusty fender on a junkyard Ford, Tom Cotter is inspired to clean up the whole car, get it running, and take it on a road trip from Texas to Kansas and find more barn finds along the way!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | New V-12 sports cars: the Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Mia Lovell, Westin Workman, Lucas Weisenberg, and Henry Drury.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa
programme.desc: Full Review: Genesis G90, a sign of amazing things to come

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn finds of the Owls Head Transportation Museum
programme.desc: What happens to barn finds if nobody buys them? Well, Tom Cotter finds out that some of them end up at Owls Head Transportation Museum in Owls Head, Maine. Next, Tom uncovers a "Frankenstein" Jaguar E-Type with a Chevy V-8 engine.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ferrari Dino, AMC Javelin, Buicks and Alfas
programme.desc: With the help of a friend, Tom discovers a cache of rare and forgotten cars hidden away in Virginia. Next, Tom visits two other friends to check out their interesting collections of cars.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchple | New Shelby Cobra, Original Mazda RX-7 FD
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the BRAND NEW Shelby Cobra. Does it live up to the legend? Next, Henry does a retro review on a completely original Mazda RX-7 FD.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rolls Royces, Tri-Five Chevys, and vintage Volkswagens
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers 5 Rolls Royces and a huge collection of Buicks in the Appalachian Mountains. Next, it's a stash of Tri-Five Chevrolets, some vintage VWs, and a unique 1930's Dodge sedan.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1 of 3 Santee SS, a "compact" Shelby GT500, dune buggies, and a Morris Minor Traveler
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a Santee SS with an aluminum block Buick V-8 engine, one of only 3 ever made. Next, Tom is introduced to a "compact" Shelby GT500 along with a plethora of other interesting barn finds.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tom's Top 10 Barn Finds from the show
programme.desc: Tom Cotter breaks down his "Top 10" barn finds from the show so far, then goes to visit a friend and hears the story of a lost 1967 Austin Mini Cooper S.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | All of Jay Leno's Barn Finds: How He Found Them & Untold Stories
programme.desc: Jay Leno shows Tom his favorite "barn find" cars in his incredible personal collection.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen
programme.desc: Hong Kong's underground car scene.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Inherited barn find collection and a wild fiberglass coupe
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets two brothers who just inherited a lifetime collection of eclectic cars. After that, Tom finds an extremely unique fiberglass coupe that once ran on "half of a Deusenberg" engine.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Turner's Auto Wrecking and hidden Porsche 356
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter gets exclusive access to Turner's Auto Wrecking in Fresno, California. After that, he heads high up in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado to discover a Porsche 356 and more.

programme.desc: Henry Catchpole puts the latest fast Audi Avant through its paces around town, in the hills and on the amazing Ascari race track in Southern Spain.Next, Henry jumps in another high-performance wagon, the BMW M3 Touring.

programme.title: Will It Run?
programme.desc: Can we get a nearly 100-year old car to run after it's been sitting for several decades?

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen

programme.title: Corky Coker's Honest Charley Garage
programme.desc: Corky tells us about his 1911 Pierce Arrow, the Honest Charley crew installs the carbuetors and filters on the Jaguar restoration, then we travel with Corky for a new acqusition for the museum.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Toyota 2000GT and Nissan 240Z
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa dives into the story of Toyota's 2000GT, which was one of the fastest cars in history. Next, Jason gives us the fascinating history behind the Datsun (Nissan) 240Z.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rare glimpse inside Blake's Auto Salvage
programme.desc: Rare glimpse inside Blake's Auto Salvage.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen
programme.desc: Larry reunites with his old friend David Egan, the mastermind behind Drift Games

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Chevy Corvette ZR-1 and GMC Cyclone
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa starts off with the fascinating story behind the ZR-1 Corvette. After that, Jason dives into GMC Syclone, which was the world's fastest pickup truck... for 30 years!

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa
programme.desc: The Tesla Roadster Tricked Enthusiasts Into Loving Evs

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ray Evernham's Secret Obsession w/ IROC Cars
programme.desc: Ray Evernham's Secret Obsession w/ IROC Cars & Owning the "American Graffiti" Car

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Expensive Toyotas, and the #1 GT-R Restoration Shop
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Bogotá, Colombia, to visit a world-famous Toyota Land Cruiser shop, The FJ Company. Next, Larry reveals the magic behind Garage Yoshida, the world's leading Nissan GT-R restoration shop.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Oldsmobiles, Mopars, Pontiacs and Fords!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds Oldsmobile barn find heaven (with some Mopars and Pontiacs sprinkled in for good measure). After that, Tom stumbles upon a 1970 Shelby Mustang GT500 buried in a garage, but in amazing condition.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - 2024 Mustang and 1990s Sedans
programme.desc: Race 1: 2024 Mustang Dark Horse vs Lotus Emira, M2, Supra, Camaro, ChallengerRace 2: The Fastest 5-Seaters of the 1990s - W124 500E v RS2 v M5 Touring + ND2

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1969 COPO Camaro, 1969 Mustang Mach 1, and a 1969 Z/28 Camaro RS
programme.desc: Colin Comer starts this episode out with an original 1969 double COPO Camaro before moving onto a well-driven and well-loved 1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1. To wrap things up, Colin appraises a well-documented 1969 Chevy Camaro Z/28 "DZ-code."

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | One of the BEST and MOST Versatile Car Collections We've Ever Seen
programme.desc: Tom spends the day with Charles Gould and his micro car collection.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Resurrecting rare Fords, and an incredible Shelby Cobra story
programme.desc: Tom Cotter begins this episode with a 29-year old who is "living the dream" resurrecting rare, old Fords. After that, Tom has the unique opportunity to see Herbie Hancock's Shelby Cobra that the famous musician has owned since new.

programme.title: Corky Coker's Honest Charley Garage

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $900 Richard Petty engine, Ford Galaxies and a rare Mach 1 Mustang
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets "Snowball" Bishop, tours his personal junkyard, and gets some great stories about NASCAR and dirt track racing from the "good ol' days." Next, Tom gets the details on a rare Ford Mustang Mach 1 with a factory 429 Cobra Jet engine.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | 2025 Aston Martin Vantage and Bentley Continental GT
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews latest Aston Martin Vantage, equipped with a powerful twin-turbo V-8. Next, Henry drives the Bentley Continental GT which, while losing it's legendary W-12 engine, still provides a ton of fun via a hybrid-enhanced turbo V-8.

programme.title: Will It Run?
programme.desc: We got the engine running, but this Challenger deserved more effort… Will it DRIVE?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find Story - Rare Ferrari and 427 Cobra Hidden for Decades
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a barn find motherlode! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies a rare Ferrari and a 427 Shelby Cobra that have been sitting for decades. This is the story of the find, removal, and auction of these amazing vehicles.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded pain on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a property Midland, Texas, absolutely filled with old cars. An old Ford wagon catches his eye and Tom attempts to cut through the sun-faded, dust-covered quarter panel to reveal its former glory.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Jaguar E-Type, 1927 Chrysler, and a GTO parked for 40 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter comes across an all-original 1967 Jaguar E-Type and wide variety of MGs, along with a 1927 Chrysler 60 that's original down to the door knobs and electrical. Next up, a Pontiac GTO that has been parked for over 40 years.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Hidden 30 years: GMC Syclone, Porsche 930 Turbo, Lotus Indy Car & More!
programme.desc: Tom uncovers iconic cars from the early 1940s to the early 1990s.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Original Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom uncovers RS and SS Chevy Camaros in a dusty building in Arizona. These vehicles were eventually purchased and their restoration process has begun, so Tom hops on Zoom with the new owner to see how the projects are going!

programme.title: Will It Run?
programme.desc: Davin works on a batch of neglected Opel GTs.

programme.title: MODIFIED - Modern-day California Hot Rods

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Blue-Eyed Butcher
programme.desc: Based on the shocking true story about a beautiful young wife and mother accused of the brutal murder of her seemingly perfect husband.

programme.title: 7 Seconds

programme.desc: A reformed thief is drawn back into a burglary-gone-wrong that lands him on death row, until he mysteriously wakes up in a psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: The 6th Day

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: The Jane Austen classic portrays two sisters, one pragmatic, the other overly emotional, who both fall in love with men who are promised to others.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Montana, this is the tale of a Colonel and his three sons who compete for the affections of the same young woman.

programme.title: A Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: When an Arizona astronomer discovers a comet heading toward Earth, the president attempts to divert it by using a nuclear missile.

programme.title: Runaway
